newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end up ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end up ahead of weekend.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished slightly higher on Friday amid squaring of short positions before the Saturday-Sunday weekend, dealers said.
"Apparently genuine investment is not emerging and hence speculators are just dragging the KSE (Karachi Stock Exchange) index," dealer Ali Hussain Rajanali said.

The KSE's 100-share index rose 3.53 points, or 0.23 percent, to end at 1,542.35. Losers led gainers 112 to 69. Turnover fell to 27 million shares from 58 million in the previous session on Wednesday before Thursday's May Day holiday.
Muslim Commercial Bank rose 0.25 to 32.25 rupees, Dewan Salman Fibre 0.65 to 34.95 and PTCL telecom utility 0.55 to 25.35.
Hub Power Co rose 0.05 to 37.70, Shell Pakistan 1.0 to 236 and ICI Pakistan 0.30 to 24.40.
